page.title: 02THE VILLAGE HALL-WEBHEATH
page.content: It is a wooden building with mineral felt roofing, consisting of two rooms one large one small.It was built in 1923 .It housed the village school for many years until the present school was completed in 1959. It is now the centre for much village life. Each weekday a small playgroup inhabits the main hall.In the evening various societies such as Brownies, Cubs, Guides, Scouts, British Legion, Mums and Toddlers, W.V.S., Keep-fit, Ladies Circle and others hold their meetings. Annually, the societies christmas concert happens, for the entertainment of all village residents. Other events like Fetes, Jumble sales, and Bring and Buy sales take place. Recently the British Legion Remembrance Day services have been held here owing to a dispute with the local church where it had always previously taken place.
